edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats

Class SimpleFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats.AbstractFormatter
      • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.model.formats.SimpleFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Formatter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NquadsFormatter, RdfXmlFormatter, TurtleFormatter

    public class SimpleFormatter
extends AbstractFormatter
    This class implements a simple formatter that needs no parsing of additional information in Accept or Content-Type headers and is completely clear with just format and format string info
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleFormatter(Format format, java.lang.String formatString)
      Creates a new simple formatter for the given format and using the given formatString

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String format(FormattableObject obj)
      Formats a given FormattableObject with this formatter
      java.lang.String getContentType()
      Return a String representation of this formatter that can be used in the HTTP Responses as ContentType Header
      java.lang.String getFormatString()
      Return the Format-String used to recognize this Format in HTTP Accept Headers This includes only the part denoting the media type, but not additional information provided.
      void setAcceptPart(java.lang.String acceptPart, FormattableObject.Type type)
      Updates this formatter with additional information provided by the HTTP Accept header.

    • Method Detail

      • getFormatString

        public java.lang.String getFormatString()
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        Return the Format-String used to recognize this Format in HTTP Accept Headers

        This includes only the part denoting the media type, but not additional information provided.

        Returns:
        The formatString

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(FormattableObject obj)

        Formats a given FormattableObject with this formatter

      • setAcceptPart

        public void setAcceptPart(java.lang.String acceptPart,
                          FormattableObject.Type type)
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        Updates this formatter with additional information provided by the HTTP Accept header.

        This method must always be called, eventually with a null value, if the format does not need additional info, or this formatter cannot be used / is inValid

        Parameters:
        acceptPart - The part of the HTTP Accept Header with additional information
        type - The type of Object this formatter will be used with. May be null.

      • getContentType

        public java.lang.String getContentType()
        Description copied from interface: Formatter
        Return a String representation of this formatter that can be used in the HTTP Responses as ContentType Header
        Returns:
        String representation for ContentType HTTP Header
